intro: Solanum schoenbrunnense, commonly known as the Schönbrunn nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale green. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It is often found in regions with high altitudes and arid conditions.
